sn9.7:1.1: At one time Venerable Nagadatta was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
sn9.7:1.2: Now at that time Venerable Nagadatta had been entering the village too early and returning late in the day.
sn9.7:1.3: Then the deity haunting that forest had sympathy for Nagadatta, wanting what’s best for him. So they approached him wanting to stir him up, and recited these verses:
sn9.7:2.2: and returning too late in the day,
sn9.7:3.1: I’m afraid for Nagadatta; he’s reckless,
sn9.7:3.3: May he not come under the King of Death’s power,
sn9.7:3.4: under the sway of the terminator!”
sn9.7:4.1: Impelled by that deity, Venerable Nagadatta was struck with a sense of urgency.
